title: 115_s98
content: PROVIDING FOR BALANCED BUDGETS. In this section, a balanced budget is defined as total outlays not exceeding total receipts and not more than 18 percent of the GDP. The Director refers to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and Member includes Delegates or Resident Commissioners to Congress. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget determines if a House of Congress has adopted a balanced budget. If not certified by April 16, 2017, salaries are held in escrow. The House of Congress must deposit Members' compensation in an escrow account until a balanced budget is adopted for fiscal year 2018 or the end of the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress. If a balanced budget for fiscal year 2019 is not certified by April 16, 2018, Members of Congress' compensation will be held in escrow until the end of the specified period. Members of Congress' compensation will be held in escrow until the end of the specified period, during which the Director must certify a balanced budget for fiscal year 2019 or until the end of the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress. Payroll administrators must withhold and remit amounts from payments held in escrow as if they were not subject to this provision. Amounts held in escrow will be released at the end of the Congress. Members of Congress' compensation will be held in escrow until the end of the specified period, during which the Director must certify a balanced budget for fiscal year 2019 or until the end of the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress. Payroll administrators must withhold and remit amounts from payments held in escrow as if they were not subject to this provision. Amounts remaining in any escrow account under this section will be released at the end of the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress. The Secretary of the Treasury will assist payroll administrators in carrying out this subsection. The payroll administrator for each House of Congress is defined as the Chief Administrative Officer for the House of Representatives and the Secretary of the Senate. If a balanced budget is not certified for fiscal year 2020, Members of Congress' compensation will be held in escrow. Members of Congress will be paid at an annual rate of $1 if a balanced budget is not certified for fiscal year 2020 or any fiscal year thereafter before April 16 of the fiscal year before. Supermajority requirement for increasing revenue. In the Senate and the House of Representatives, a bill, joint resolution, amendment, conference report, or amendment that increases revenue requires a three-fifths majority vote. This rule is part of the Senate and House rules and supersedes other rules in such cases. The Senate and House rules require a three-fifths majority vote for any bill, resolution, or amendment that increases revenue. The constitutional right of either House to change rules relating to its procedures is recognized.
